news.title: Percentage of Black Associates in Large Firms Finally Tops 2009 Level, But Not By Much
news.description: New data show increases in the numbers of law firm associates who are women or people of color compared to a decade ago, but the increase for black associates was troublingly small.

news.title: First-Year Class Sizes for ABA-Accredited Law Schools Are Slightly Smaller in 2019
news.description: While overall enrollment at ABA-accredited law schools is higher this year than last year, the number of first-year students is slightly lower, according to data from 203 institutions.

news.title: Law Firms Are ‘Poised to Grow’ As They Report More Success in Lateral Hiring
news.description: Driven primarily by an increase in billing rates, law firms are seeking to expand their equity partnerships through lateral hires, and also hire more junior and temporary lawyers.

news.title: Legal Jobs Take Another Leap and Hit 10-Year High; What’s Driving the Increase?
news.description: Data for November show an increase in hiring among law firms of all sizes, spurred largely by interest in recruiting related to capital markets, finance, and mergers and acquisitions.
